cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest later today, then north on Saturday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and inland through the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Intracoastal City–Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle, and Intracoastal City to Cameron. Tropical Storm Watch: east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle. Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Maurepas (incl. New Orleans), and Intracoastal City to Cameron. Storm Surge Warning: Intracoastal City to Biloxi and Lake Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast (near the TX-LA border) eastward across all of coastal Louisiana into Mississippi and Alabama barrier islands.
weather_observation.wind: Port could experience occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (35-45 mph) Saturday into early Sunday, with the highest probabilities (≈27%) late Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally ≤2 ft) possible along Sabine Pass and nearby low-lying areas; significant surge of ≥3 ft is not expected for Beaumont.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain possible, but totals near Beaumont likely 1–3 inches; the 4-inch threshold is not currently expected to be exceeded.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls could produce isolated tornadoes and short-lived visibility reductions, which may intermittently disrupt cargo handling and trucking links.
